description: Selects, filters, renames, and transforms fields in data records using various selection strategies including inclusion/exclusion lists, regex patterns, and conditional logic.

data.info: Data containing fields to be selected or filtered. Can be a list of Data objects, single Data object, or JSON string.

selection_strategy.info: Method for field selection: include (select specified fields), exclude (remove specified fields), regex (pattern matching), or conditional (based on field conditions).

field_list.info: JSON array of field names to include or exclude based on the selection strategy.

field_patterns.info: JSON array of regex patterns for field name matching when using regex strategy.

selection_conditions.info: JSON object defining conditions for field selection based on field values or properties.

field_mapping.info: JSON object mapping original field names to new field names for renaming.

default_values.info: JSON object providing default values for missing fields when using include strategy.

case_sensitive.info: Whether field name matching should be case sensitive.

flatten_nested.info: Flatten nested object fields using dot notation (e.g., 'address.street').

preserve_structure.info: Maintain the original nested structure of objects when possible.

include_empty.info: Include fields with empty/null values in the output.

max_depth.info: Maximum depth to traverse for nested objects. 0 means unlimited.

strict_mode.info: In strict mode, missing required fields will cause an error instead of being skipped.

errors.no_data: No input data provided for field selection.
errors.empty_data: Input data is empty or contains no records.
errors.invalid_json: Invalid JSON format in input data.
errors.missing_required_field: Required field '{field}' not found in data.
errors.no_selection_run: Field selection must be run before accessing this output.
